medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr. B was hospitalized due to manic symptoms including decreased sleep, rapid speech, and irritability.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began when Mr. B's mother noticed manic behaviors. He exhibited decreased sleep (only 4-5 hours a night instead of his usual 8), rapid speech, and irritability, which escalated to violence when he struck his mother after an argument.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr. B has a 20-year history of type I bipolar disorder. He was previously being treated with lithium and haloperidol.
medical_history.family_history: Mr. B's father suffered from mental illness.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. B had been living with his mother and had functional disability, resulting in increasing dependence on her. He previously worked as an engineer but lost his job due to his illness.
